node.title: 'Extremely irresponsible': International students lash out after long-awaited travel plans cancelled again
node.alt: Chinese international student Zhang Yiming stands outside posing for a photo.
node.description: The snap decision to delay the easing of border restrictions leaves many international students again uncertain and confused, with experts saying it could further damage Australia's reputation as an education destination.
node.content:
["Chinese international student Zhang Yiming was finally supposed to leave for Australia this morning — 16 months after starting his law degree at the University of Newcastle.", "Instead, he has now had to cancel his $1,000 ticket from the city of Harbin in northern China. ", "The federal government announced on Monday that in light of the emergence of the Omicron variant, the planned easing of border restrictions for international students and other eligible visa holders would be postponed until at least December 15.", "The decision has left many international students who were looking forward to their long-delayed arrival into Australia uncertain and confused.", "Experts say it has also potentially further damaged Australia's reputation as an education destination. ", "Mr Zhang, who said he had turned down an internship at one of the most prestigious law firms in Shanghai for his now-delayed trip, had his flight cancelled just 12 hours before the departure. ", ""The decision is extremely irresponsible for temporary visa holders, who were left without any time to prepare and respond to the urgent announcement," the 28-year-old told the ABC.", "", "
International students whose studies have been on hold due to COVID are feeling deflated after news of another delay due to the new Omicron variant.(AAP: Joel Carrett)
", "The NSW government announced on Tuesday that despite the federal government's delay on easing border restrictions, it will proceed with its pilot program to charter two flights with 250 vaccinated international students.", "When the flights touch down in Sydney on December 6 and 24, the students will be subject to strict new quarantine measures introduced over the past few days.", "Unfortunately for Mr Zhang and many others, their privately-arranged travel plans are still up in the air. ", "", "
Julie Eti was was given a scholarship through the Australia Awards Program and was due to start her university degree in Melbourne this year.  (Supplied)
", "The news to pause arrivals has also dashed the hopes of students across the Pacific who are waiting eagerly to start their studies in Australia.", "After postponing her studies this year, Samoan student Julie Eti was hopeful that 2022 would be her year to finally start her degree in Melbourne.", "The 18-year-old was given a scholarship through the Australia Awards Program, and had been optimistic after receiving an email last week saying that borders would be opening on December 1. ", ""It was really devastating. It's making me lose all hope that we actually might be able to come," Ms Eti said. ", "
Australia's reputation further tarnished 
", "Kirk Yan, a Melbourne-based migration agent and an advocate for international students and temporary residents in Australia, told the ABC the announcement would see a further decline of confidence in Australia's border policies.", ""Other popular studying destinations such as Canada, the United Kingdom and the United States, which opened their borders to international students way earlier than Australia, haven't closed their borders due to Omicron," Mr Yan said.", "Universities Australia chief executive Catriona Jackson said universities would continue to work closely with federal, state, and territory governments to do everything possible to assist international students seeking to return to Australia as soon as it is safe to do so.", ""Around 130,000 higher education students remain outside of Australia hoping anxiously to return in time for the first semester next year," she said.", ""We understand this delay is challenging for students and universities. It's important to acknowledge the incredible resilience of those who have waited patiently for up to two years to resume their studies on campus."", "
Uncertainty takes its toll on mental health 
", "Andina Dwifatma is another one of those stuck offshore.", "She has been doing her doctoral study from Jakarta and a couple weeks ago received several emails inviting her to come back to Australia.", ""The latest advice I received stated that there would be no more hotel quarantine once Australia hit 90 per cent [vaccination rate]," she said.", ""However, since Omicron variant emerged, there has been no update," she said, adding that the travel restriction may affect her plan to come back to Melbourne early next year.", "", "
Andina Dwifatma says she already made a plan to come to Australia to continue her PhD at Monash University early next year.(Supplied)
", "Ms Dwifatma said while she understood Australia's travel restrictions, it has hit her mental health "very hard".", "She added that if Australia reimposed quarantine rules for international travellers, her university scholarship didn't cover it.", ""Reopening the Australian border to international students does not mean everyone could afford all costs," she said.", "
A 'non compassionate response'
", "Belle WX Lim, an international student from Malaysia in Melbourne, said she understood the need to change travel policies, however, she felt there was "a lack of appreciation and recognition" for Australian temporary visa holders, such as international students like her.", "Ms Lim, who is the former president of Council of International Students Australia, said "it's a very non compassionate response," adding that she hoped to see more support from the Australian government.", ""These students have paid $40,000 in tuition fees, not including the rent that they have paid, their belongings are here … and now they stuck offshore for two years," she said.", "", "
Ms Lim, the former president of Council of International Students Australia, says the federal governemnt should be providing more support. (Supplied)
", "Prime Minister Scott Morrison said the temporary pause was made on the basis of expert medical advice.", "The National Security Committee statement said it would "ensure Australia can gather the information we need to better understand the Omicron variant".", "Education Minister Alan Tudge told the ABC that given high vaccination rates, he was hopeful the pause would be lifted on December 15, as planned. ", ""I know this will be disappointing for some students looking to come to Australia, but it is only a temporary pause," he said.", ""We have one of the most highly vaccinated populations in the world and that puts Australia in a very good position. The government will continue to monitor the situation as it evolves in line with public health advice."", "
One of the lucky ones 
", "After almost two years waiting for the border to reopen, Mario Johan Hartono, a student at the University of Technology Sydney, woke up to the news about the pilot program going ahead this afternoon and couldn't contain his excitement.", ""I'm so excited, especially after thinking about the worst possible scenarios of the plan being cancelled and how we won't get our money back if that happens," he told the ABC.", ""I feel that UTS has been very supportive in helping international students to come back to Australia. But even up to this point, I still want to keep my expectations low after so many failed attempts to go to Australia in the past."", "Mr Hartono is among the 250 international students from over 15 countries that will fly on the first chartered plane under The NSW International Student Pilot Plan.", "", "
Mario Johan Harton is among the 250 international students who will still be able to enter Australia through a NSW pilot program, despite the pause on arrivals. (Supplied)
", "Mr Hartono received an email from UTS in October about how he had been chosen to be a part of the pilot plan and was asked to pay about $2,000 to secure his spot.", "He said he would be given access to airport transfer and free accommodation in Sydney for two weeks.", "Under the new border rules, all international arrivals must spend 72 hours in isolation at their home or accommodation after touching down in Australia.", "The international students who enter NSW will isolate at a student accommodation facility in Sydney for the three days.", "Although he's excited that he can still make it to Sydney in the coming weeks, Mr Hartono said he felt "very sorry to hear the news about other international students who are not in the program".", ""Some of them must have booked flights only to hear about the terrible news. I feel empathetic towards them."", "", "
